title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No.
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Destructive Insects and Pests Acts 1958
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Destructive Insects and Pests Acts 1958 

and 1991 (Pre-Notification) Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited destructive insect pest act 1958 1991 (pre-notification) order 2020

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No.
heading: 2. This Order applies to Quercus, plants and trees.
text_raw: 2. This Order applies to Quercus, plants and trees.

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No.
heading: 3. For the purposes of this Order
text_raw:
3. For the purposes of this Order 

“inspector authorised by the Minister” means an authorised officer 
appointed under Regulation 11 of the European Communities (Control 
of Organisms Harmful to Plants and Plant Products) Regulations 2004 
(S.I. No. 894 of 2004).
text_norm: 3 purpose order inspector authorised minister mean authorised officer appointed regulation 11 european community (control organism harmful plant plant products) regulation 2004 (s.i no 894 2004)

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No.
heading: 4. (1) A person shall not land into or keep Thaumetopoea processionea in
text_raw:
4. (1) A person shall not land into or keep Thaumetopoea processionea in 

the State unless authorised by the Minister. 

(2) A person shall not cause Thaumetopoea processionea to spread in the 

State. 

(3) A person shall not land Quercus plants or trees into the State without 
notifying the Minister in writing at least two days in advance, giving the 
following particulars of each consignment: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the intended date of their landing into the State; 

the intended destination; 

the genus, species and quantity; 

(d) 

the identification number of the supplier of the plants; 

(e) 

the country from which they have been consigned. 

(4) A person who lands Thaumetopoea processionea in the State in 
contravention of paragraph (3) shall remove or destroy the plants or trees in 
accordance with directions of the Minister. 

(5) The Minister shall not be liable for the cost of any removal or 

destruction under paragraph (4). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 4th February, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [30] 3

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No.
heading: 5. (1) The Minister may give a direction in writing for the removal or
text_raw:
5. (1) The Minister may give a direction in writing for the removal or 
destruction of a plant or tree product which is infected with Thaumetopoea 
processionea or which in the opinion of an inspector authorised by the Minister 
appears— 

(a) 

(b) 

to be infected by Thaumetopoea processionea, or 

likely to spread Thaumetopoea processionea. 

(2) The Minister may by notice, prohibit the keeping, selling or exposing or 

offering for sale, or the keeping or the distribution in any manner - 

(a) 

(b) 

a plant or tree product which is infected by Thaumetopoea 
processionea, or 

a plant or tree product which in the opinion of an inspector 
authorised by 
infected by 
Thaumetopoea processionea. 

the Minister appears 

to be 

(3) A notice issued under paragraph (2) may be issued or published in a 

manner the Minister considers appropriate. 

(4) The Minister may amend, withdraw or suspend a notice issued under 

paragraph (2).

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No.
heading: 6. An inspector authorised by the Minister may carry out any or all the
text_raw:
6. An inspector authorised by the Minister may carry out any or all the 
functions in section 3(2)(c) of the Destructive Insects and Pests Acts 1958 and 
1991 for the purposes of preventing the spread of Thaumetopoea processionea.
text_norm: 6 inspector authorised minister may carry function section 3(2)(c) destructive insect pest act 1958 1991 purpose preventing spread thaumetopoea processionea

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No.
heading: 7. This Order is in addition to, and not in substitution for, the European
text_raw:
7. This Order is in addition to, and not in substitution for, the European 
Communities (Control of Organisms Harmful to Plants and Plant Products) 
Regulations 2004 to 2019. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 January, 2020. 

MICHAEL CREED, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [30]

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No.
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

This Order is made under the Destructive Insects and Pests Acts 1958 and 1991 
and provides for measures to be put in place to prevent the introduction of 
Thaumetopoea processionea (Oak Processionary Moth) into the Country.
